# Stencil Webfont Test

This is a reduced test case showing the Stencil component's failure to request & use Google font faces (or any other 3rd party font with a comparable API).

## Getting Started

To start building a new web component using Stencil, clone this repo to a new directory:

```bash
git clone git@github.com:jdsteinbach/stencil-webfont-test.git
cd stencil-webfont-test
```

and run:

```bash
npm install
npm start
```

View the page in your browser at [localhost:3333](http://localhost:3333).

* If you see a chunky comic-brush font, everything worked.
* If you see a pixelated Mario font, only the `index.html` Google font request worked (not the component-embedded request).
* If you see a system default serif font, everything font-related has failed.

If you view requests in your DevTools Network pane, you should see 2 CSS requests to `fonts.googleapis.com`: one for "Press+Start+2P" (initiated by `index.html`) and one for "Luckiest+Guy" (initiated by the component's styles). You'll also see a Font request to `fonts.gstatic.com` - this matches "Press+Start+2P". If the "Luckiest+Guy" font were being loaded also, things would be working well. But so far, that's not the case.

When a font CSS file is requested from within a component, the browser fails to request the linked font files.
